snippet: In a nation troubled by corruption, blackouts and the scourge of Boko Haram, stand-up comics are mining the misery for laughs and are more popular than ever.
abstract: Stand-up comedy is thriving in Nigeria, nation suffering from number of serious problems; comedy had become nation's third-most popular form of entertainment, behind music and movies, drawing aspiring performers to thriving scenes in Lagos and other cities; experts say political corruption and travails of daily life have created need for comic relief.
lead_paragraph: In a nation troubled by corruption, blackouts and the scourge of Boko Haram, stand-up comics are mining the misery for laughs and are more popular than ever.

headline.main: Nigeria’s Comics Pull Punch Lines From Deeper Social Ills
headline.print_headline: In a Nigeria in Need of Laughs, Comedians Have Crowds Roaring
